name: PartyNextDoor
description:
'''Jahron Anthony Brathwaite''' (born July 3, 1993), known professionally as '''PartyNextDoor''' (often stylized in [[all caps]]), is a Canadian singer, songwriter, rapper and record producer. He was the first artist to sign with [[Drake (musician)|Drake]]'s record label [[OVO Sound]], an [[Record label#Imprint|imprint]] of [[Warner Records]] in 2013. His [[PartyNextDoor (mixtape)|self-titled debut mixtape]] was released through the label in July that year, and met with critical praise.

His debut studio album, ''[[PartyNextDoor Two]]'' (2014), was released the following year and supported by the single "[[Recognize (PartyNextDoor song)|Recognize]]" (featuring Drake), which received [[RIAA certification|quadruple platinum]] certification by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA). His second album, ''[[PartyNextDoor 3]]'' (2016), saw further success and peaked at number three on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], while spawning his first [[Canadian Hot 100]] and [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] entries with its singles "[[Come and See Me]]" (featuring Drake) and "Not Nice". His third album, ''[[Partymobile]]'' (2020), was met with similar commercial success and supported by his highest-charting singles on both charts: "[[Loyal (PartyNextDoor song)|Loyal]]" (featuring Drake) and "[[Believe It (PartyNextDoor and Rihanna song)|Believe It]]" (with [[Rihanna]]). His fourth album, ''[[PartyNextDoor 4]]'' (2024), was followed by his collaborative album with label boss Drake, ''[[Some Sexy Songs 4 U]]'' (2025), which became his first to debut atop both the [[Billboard Canadian Albums|''Billboard'' Canadian Albums]] and ''Billboard'' 200.

Outside of recording, PartyNextDoor has been active in [[PartyNextDoor discography#Production discography|production and songwriting for other artists]]. He was credited on Rihanna's 2016 single "[[Work (Rihanna song)|Work]]" and [[DJ Khaled]]'s 2017 single "[[Wild Thoughts]]", which peaked at numbers one and two on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, respectively. PartyNextDoor has also contributed to releases by [[Kanye West]], [[Usher (musician)|Usher]], [[Christina Aguilera]], [[Post Malone]], [[City Girls]], [[Ne-Yo]], [[Justine Skye]], and [[Jay Park]], among others.
